Package com.ez.wireless.cellphone.capstone.shipping

Class ShippingLabel

java.lang.Object
com.ez.wireless.cellphone.capstone.shipping.ShippingLabel
public class ShippingLabel
extends java.lang.Object
Creates a shipping label using the EasyPost API
Author:
Dakota Harvey

  • Constructor Details

    • ShippingLabel

      public ShippingLabel​(java.lang.String Fname, java.lang.String Lname, java.lang.String company, java.lang.String street1, java.lang.String street2, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String GeoRegion, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String mailCode, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String email, boolean residental, java.lang.String postalService, double weight) throws com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
      Takes in information from the frontend, calls local methods to map the to and from a addresses out, creates a parcel from the postal service and weight of a package. Then calls the API to create a shipping label for the end user.
      Parameters:
      Fname - First name
      Lname - Last name
      company - Company (Optional if residential is true)
      street1 - First addressed street
      street2 - Second addressed street
      city - City/town Name
      GeoRegion - Geographical Region (E.G. State, Province, etc.)
      country - Country
      mailCode - Mail code (E.G. zip code, postal code, etc.)
      message - Message to recipient (Optional)
      phone - Phone number
      email - Email Address
      residental - Address residentiality
      postalService - Postal Service Provider (E.G. USPS, Canada Post, etc.)
      weight - Package weight
      Throws:
      com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException - Said exception is being handled by the subclasses

  • Method Details

    • toAddress

      private com.easypost.model.Address toAddress() throws com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
      Takes in the client info from the database into a map, then converted into an address then returned.
      Parameters:
      ac - the clients account in shorthand form
      Returns:
      the client's address
      Throws:
      com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException - as info is assumed to be correct in the database

    • fromAddress

      private com.easypost.model.Address fromAddress​(java.lang.String Fname, java.lang.String Lname, java.lang.String company, java.lang.String street1, java.lang.String street2, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String GeoRegion, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String mailCode, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String email, boolean residental) throws com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
      Takes in info passed from the constructor and puts them into a map. Which said map is converted into an address and returned. Values that are sent as null will not be printed on the label. Only name, company, street1, city, GeoRegion, Country, and mailCode are required.
      Parameters:
      Fname - The first name of the person
      Lname - The last name of the person
      company - The company name
      street1 - The street location
      street2 - The second street location
      city - The city name
      GeoRegion - The Geographical Region (E.G. State, Province, Etc.)
      country - The Country Name
      mailCode - The mail code (E.G. Zip code, Postal Code, Etc.)
      message - The message to the recipient
      phone - The Phone number
      email - The email address
      residental - if the person is shipping from a residence
      Returns:
      The senders Address
      Throws:
      com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException

    • parcel

      private com.easypost.model.Parcel parcel​(java.lang.String postalService, double weight) throws com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
      Takes in a postal service identifier as well as the parcel's weight. It puts said information into a map and returns a parcel. Postal service identifiers are located at https://www.easypost.com/docs/api/java#carrier-tracking-strings
      Parameters:
      postalService - postal service identifier
      weight - parcel weight
      Returns:
      the parcel
      Throws:
      com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException

    • ship

      public java.lang.String ship​(java.lang.String postalService) throws com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
      Takes in a postal service identifier and the shipping map fields, then uses said information to generate a png image of the shipping label. Postal service identifiers are located at https://www.easypost.com/docs/api/java#carrier-tracking-strings
      Parameters:
      postalService - postal service identifier
      Returns:
      the shipping label image
      Throws:
      com.easypost.exception.EasyPostException
